edu.rit.m2mp.packet
Class PacketPool

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.packet.PacketPool
public class PacketPool
extends Object

Class PacketPool encapsulates a pool of packets in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP). Instances of class IncomingPacket and OutgoingPacket are allocated from a packet pool, then are released back to the packet pool when no longer needed. To prevent excessive storage consumption in a small device, the packet pool enforces an upper bound on the number of packets that can be allocated simultaneously. By reusing already-existing packets, the packet pool reduces the overhead that would otherwise be required to allocate fresh packets from the heap and garbage collect them afterwards.

Any of the following may cause the packet pool to run out of packets:

  • Failing to close the output stream when done writing an outgoing message, including if an exception is thrown while writing.

  • Failing to close the input stream when done reading an incoming message, including if an exception is thrown while reading.

  • Failing to accept and read incoming messages from an open incoming message notifier.

  • Failing to close an incoming message notifier when no longer accepting messages from it.

  • Sending outgoing messages at a faster rate than receiving incoming messages. This can happen if the sending thread doesn't let the receiving thread have enough processor time.

When the packet pool runs out of packets, incoming messages will no longer be received, and creating an outgoing message will throw an OutOfPacketsException. Make sure your M2MP application is designed properly and does not get into the above situations.

Note: Class PacketPool is multiple thread safe.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Constructor Detail

PacketPool

public PacketPool(int theMaxCount)
Construct a new packet pool.

Parameters:
theMaxCount - Maximum number of byte buffers that can be allocated from this packet pool.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theMaxCount is less than or equal to 0.
Method Detail

allocateIncomingPacket

public IncomingPacket allocateIncomingPacket()
                                      throws OutOfPacketsException
Allocate an incoming packet from this packet pool (non-blocking version). If some of this packet pool’s incoming packets are not in use, this method returns a free incoming packet. If all of this packet pool’s incoming packets are in use, this method throws an OutOfPacketsException.

Returns:
Incoming packet.
Throws:
OutOfPacketsException - Thrown if all of this packet pool’s incoming packets are in use.

waitForIncomingPacket

public IncomingPacket waitForIncomingPacket()
                                     throws InterruptedException
Allocate an incoming packet from this packet pool (blocking version). If some of this packet pool’s incoming packets are not in use, this method returns a free incoming packet. If all of this packet pool’s incoming packets are in use, this method blocks until an incoming packet becomes available, then returns it.

Returns:
Incoming packet.
Throws:
InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread was interrupted while blocked in this method.

release

public void release(IncomingPacket thePacket)
Release the given incoming packet back to this packet pool. Assumes thePacket was originally allocated from this packet pool.

Warning: After releasing it, do not use thePacket ever again. Instead, allocate a new incoming packet.

Parameters:
thePacket - Incoming packet.

allocateOutgoingPacket

public OutgoingPacket allocateOutgoingPacket()
                                      throws OutOfPacketsException
Allocate an outgoing packet from this packet pool (non-blocking version). If some of this packet pool’s outgoing packets are not in use, this method returns a free outgoing packet. If all of this packet pool’s outgoing packets are in use, this method throws an OutOfPacketsException.

Returns:
Outgoing packet.
Throws:
OutOfPacketsException - Thrown if all of this packet pool’s outgoing packets are in use.

waitForOutgoingPacket

public OutgoingPacket waitForOutgoingPacket()
                                     throws InterruptedException
Allocate an outgoing packet from this packet pool (blocking version). If some of this packet pool’s outgoing packets are not in use, this method returns a free outgoing packet. If all of this packet pool’s outgoing packets are in use, this method blocks until an outgoing packet becomes available, then returns it.

Returns:
Outgoing packet.
Throws:
InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread was interrupted while blocked in this method.

release

public void release(OutgoingPacket thePacket)
Release the given outgoing packet back to this packet pool. Assumes thePacket was originally allocated from this packet pool.

Warning: After releasing it, do not use thePacket ever again. Instead, allocate a new outgoing packet.

Parameters:
thePacket - Outgoing packet.
